prompts: I'd like you to read through each of the files in the @mcp-specs/2025-11-25 folder --> then review the spec at @specs/docker-local-first/README.md to ensure full fidelity to the current spec. Ask me questions about any disparities you find

1. Yes, normalize all protocol version references to 2025-11-25. \
2. Yes. Add SSE polling/resumability documentation \
3. Integrate Tasks feature into main spec --> yes \
4. This is pure slop from the previous agent. There is no need to specify this: there is a protocol *version* and a protocol *specification*, these are not the same thing, and we don't need to deal with it \
5. Wait, explain this: this doesn't make sense to me at all \
6. We could do that, yes, but it's not vital right now \
7. No, that's fine \
8. This seems...low-level for a refactor --> is this document that we're updating even scoped to the specific refactor we're doing? \
9. There's no reason this table should even exist, I never asked the agent that made this for that at all \
10. Deeply unfortunately, most popular MCP clients don't support any of these three primitives. That's why they aren't include3d
